content.description: This is an awesome route with some cool climbing up to a difficult, crimpy crux at about the 5th bolt. Ease out of a little, left-facing corner and a thank good jug out left. Head easily up ramp to a devious headwall, if you blow the top get ready for a nice ride!
content.location: This is the fourth route from the top of the slab.

content.description:
This is the very first route at the very far left side of the Techno Crag - also one of the easiest, though I think

Techno Mix

is a better warm-up. It has moderate climbing up into some cracks that can be protected with a few cams/nuts if you desire, otherwise the bolting is fine.
content.location: It is all the way to the left side of the crag. Basically, it is on a separate sector than the main wall, see the pic.

content.description:
Climb up through balancy moves, clipping 5 bolts. You may wish the 5th bolt was a little lower if onsighting! Then bust right across a horizontal crack to some jugs and finish up on

High Tech

. There is a two-bolt direct variation that has not been sent, and it has vicious power moves for 9' to a jug and an independent anchor.
content.location: This is the second route from the very top of the slab, just past the fixed line on slab.

content.description: Tech X starts in the left hand of two small, left-facing corners about halfway up the slab/fixed rope. Delicately balance your way past the first couple bolts, and launch into the awesome corner and headwall above.
content.location:
This is just left of

Off on a Technicality

, about halfway up the slab/fixed line.

content.description: Climb crimps to slopers to an easier finish.
content.location:
This is just right of

Three's a Party

.

content.description: Climb up easy rock past 1 bolt to the white, left-facing corner. Puzzle your way up this to a big, undercling jug. Some reachy moves lead up to the next overlap and the crux on small, positive holds.
content.location: Midway up the slab, find two small, twin, left-facing white corners, Off On A Tech. is the right one.

content.description:
To be edited in.

Originally, this was a mixed trad/sport line that has been retrobolted into a sport climb.
content.protection:
To be edited in.

Originally trad protection, now it is retrobolted.

content.description: Great climbing up through good holds leads to a crimpy crux sequence either directly on small incuts or staying right on better holds and a difficult reach back left and then a jug. More techy climbing, good body-english here will see you confidently to the anchor.
content.location: Third route from the top of the wall. You can have belayer clip in to the fixed line, or be prepared to lift belayer off slab if you fall!

content.description:
Ease up to the first bolt and puzzle out a tricky sequence leading up and past the second bolt. Now, work up and get ready for a "head-scratcher" boulder problem getting up in the roof. Snatch some jugs and finish strong. This shares an anchor with

Techno Mix

- so it's easy to TR.
content.location: This is the furthest route up the slab, just past where the fixed line ends. Happily there is a nice flat spot to stage your shizz.

content.description:
Tip-toe up white, convex slab - just right of

All Night Rave

. Now find your way up the corner to a horizontal crack you'll wish was better. Figure out how to get to the jug about 4 feet higher, now crimp your way up and over a bulge where your feet disappear.
content.location:
This is the fifth route up from bottom of slab/fixed line. It is just right of the obvious, white corner on

All Night Rave

with which it shares an anchor.

content.description:
Start this low on the slab in a off balance, white, left-facing corner. Finesse up this to some jugs and haul away up the arete to the definitive crux. Here, heel-hooking helps and now just keep it together to the anchor, which is shared with

Fall Colors

.
content.protection: 15 or so draws, fixed lowering station.
content.location: This is the fourth route from the very bottom of the slab/fixed line. It ascends an obvious, white, left-facing corner and goes up an awesome prow.
